Too old to get a job, too young to retire: The French women over 50 stuck in limbo
Subhead: In France, 21% of people aged 55-61 struggle to find work but are unable to retire. Women, who suffer more from societal inequalities throughout their career, are particularly at risk.

Morocco seeks prosecution of over 2,400 protesters after GenZ demonstrations
Subhead: More than 2,400 people, including minors, are facing prosecution over recent GenZ 212 protests demanding better education, healthcare and an end to corruption. Dozens have already been sentenced to up to 15 years in prison.

Title: Australia creates a strategic mineral reserve to counter Chinese dominance
Subhead: With this project, as well as through its partnership with the US, this major producer of critical metals is seeking to develop a sovereign capacity for mineral processing.

Title: Controversy swirls around Romania's new 'National Cathedral,' now the largest in the Orthodox world
Subhead: After 15 years of construction, the Romanian People's Salvation Cathedral now towers over Bucharest, having opened its doors to the public on Sunday. A source of pride for many Romanians, it has also drawn criticism for its cost, which was largely funded by public money.

Title: Louvre heist: 'To think we could replace the works with replicas is almost to deny what they are'
Subhead: Olivier Gabet, director of the Louvre Museum's decorative arts department, says that, far beyond their insurance value, the stolen jewels have aesthetic, artistic, national heritage and historical significance.

Three exhibitions in Paris celebrate 100 years of Art Deco
Subhead: To mark the centenary of the International Exhibition of Modern Decorative and Industrial Arts, three venues are showcasing a leading figure of the movement, the archives of a renowned trunk-maker and contemporary creations.

Title: French lawmakers debate 'confiscatory' taxation in budget talks
Subhead: On Monday, French MPs voted in favor of a government amendment to increase a tax on large corporations by €2 billion. But how far can taxes be raised before they reach intolerable levels?

Title: 'Why did they run from the police?': 20 years after two French teens' deaths, the question is as relevant as ever
Subhead: For many people of color, fleeing a police stop has become a reflex. Sociologists say this risky behavior stems from the rise in incidents of police violence.
